title: Bill Belichick's feud with Patriots could benefit UNC
content: Belichick might be relentlessly focused on actually reaching the playoff ... if only to show up Robert Kraft.

title: 49ers' QB Purdy a 'long shot' to play in Week 2

title: Kelce takes blame for Worthy injury: 'No excuse'

title: NCAA: 3 hoops players bet on their own games
content: A Fresno State men's basketball player manipulated his performance for gambling purposes and conspired with two players to place bets on his statistics, according to findings from an NCAA investigation released Wednesday.

title: Scheffler adjusts Ryder Cup prep after sting of '23
content: Scottie Scheffler said he's doing things differently this year after his preparation going into the 2023 Ryder Cup was "not as good as it should have been."

title: Buzzer-heave misses won't affect NBA player stats
content: The NBA will implement a change for the 2025-26 season with unsuccessful end-of-period heaves being recorded as a missed attempt for the team, not the player.

title: Woman charged in deaths of Marquette athletes
content: A Wisconsin driver involved in a traffic crash last week that killed two Marquette University lacrosse players was drunk at the time, authorities alleged Wednesday in charging her with vehicular homicide.

title: Rizzo retiring as a Cub after 14 seasons in MLB
content: Cubs legend Anthony Rizzo, who helped the team win a World Series title in 2016, is retiring after 14 major league seasons and will join the organization as an ambassador going forward.

title: SEC coaches back portal move, buck Day concern
content: SEC coaches say they are in favor of the proposed move of college football's transfer portal window from December to January, arguing it's the best option even if it conflicts with the College Football Playoff schedule.

content: Tennessee quarterback Cam Ward's debut didn't go as planned, but there were positives to take away from it.

content: Witt or Judge? Ohtani or De La Cruz? We narrow the field -- with a rep from every team -- to one true must-watch player.

content: The Eagles added some running back depth behind Saquon Barkley, but did they give up too much for Bigsby? We sized up the deal from both sides.

content: Pep Guardiola's exit from Man City feels imminent and this season may be his last dance -- even if it means he can't go out on a high note.

content: The EuroBasket is the top international basketball competition for European teams. Check out all-time men's and women's winners now.

content: As odds shift for the Heisman Trophy and national title, Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet each of them.

title: New faces, new places: Ranking the top 14 newcomers for the 2025-26 NBA season
content: Coach Mike Brown, Kevin Durant, Myles Turner and others are ranked by who will be the most impactful on their new teams.

title: The strangely specific transfer obsessions of elite clubs, and what the summer window taught us about them
content: Every team has preferences when it comes to transfers ... but some are more surprising than others. What did we learn this summer about Real Madrid's, Arsenal's and other elite clubs' fixations?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Madrid eye move for Stuttgart's Stiller
content: Real Madrid are reportedly keeping tabs on a possible move for VfB Stuttgart midfielder Angelo Stiller.

title: Israeli Strike '"killed Any Hope" For Gaza Hostages, Says Qatar PM
content: Qatar's prime minister said Wednesday that an Israeli strike in Doha on Hamas killed hope for hostages in Gaza as he called for his Israeli counterpart Benjamin Netanyahu to be "brought to justice."

title: Israeli Strike '"killed Any Hope" For Gaza Hostages, Says Qatar PM
content: Qatar's prime minister said Wednesday that an Israeli strike in Doha on Hamas killed hope for hostages in Gaza as he called for his Israeli counterpart Benjamin Netanyahu to be "brought to justice."

title: "Act Without Delay": Thadou Tribe Seeks Action Against Kuki Insurgents In Assam, Writes To Chief Minister
content: Members of the Thadou tribe held a protest in Assam's Guwahati on Wednesday seeking justice for Thadou leader Nehkam Jomhao, who was tortured and killed by Kuki insurgents in Karbi Anglong last month.

title: Trump Ally And Right-Wing Activist Charlie Kirk Shot At US University
content: Right-wing youth activist Charlie Kirk, a major ally of President Donald Trump, was shot Wednesday at a US university, multiple media reported.

title: Why Portrait Of Former Nepal King Behind Army Chief Is Drawing Attention
content: Nepal's political turmoil deepened this week as mass protests against corruption, unemployment, and political instability turned violent, leaving at least 20 people dead.

title: Woman Clings To Side Of Auto, Cries Out For Help To Avoid Being Robbed
content: A woman in Ludhiana foiled a robbery attempt in an autorickshaw by three men, including the driver, by clinging to the side of the moving vehicle and alerting passing commuters, who forced the vehicle to stop, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Cab Driver Masturbates In Front Of Student During Ride In Delhi, Arrested
content: A 48-year-old Rapido cab driver was arrested for allegedly masturbating in front of a woman student during a ride in north Delhi's Maurice Nagar area, police said on Wednesday.

title: Can Help With Racism, Xenophobia: India Jabs Switzerland Over Minority Remark
content: India has issued a rebuttal to Switzerland at the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC), describing comments made by the Swiss delegation on the treatment of minorities in India as "surprising, shallow, and ill-informed."

title: India's "Dump Truck" Swipe After Pakistan's Speech At UN
content: India has slammed Pakistan at the UN Human Rights Council, saying it doesn't need lessons from a "terror sponsor" that continues to finance and shelter the very networks that threaten global security.

title: From Single Lamp Lit In 1996, We Touch 9.6 Million Lives Annually: Gautam Adani
content: Gautam Adani, Chairman of the Adani Group, on Wednesday said he was proud of his wife Dr Priti Adani's keynote at the Asian Venture Philanthropy Network (AVPN) summit in Hong Kong, reinforcing the Group's commitment to empower millions of lives.

title: Congress Versus BJP Over Alleged Spycam In Rajasthan Assembly Premises
content: The Monsoon Session of the Rajasthan Assembly might have concluded, but it has left behind a fresh political storm.

title: Hospital Hid The Fact That Newborn Was Bitten By Rat, Claims Father
content: Family members of one of the two newborn girls who died after allegedly being bitten by rats in the ICU of state-run MY Hospital (MYH) here on Wednesday accused its administration of negligence and misleading them on the exact cause of her death.

title: 'Advent Of Mobile Phones Leading To Loneliness, People Taking Extreme Step': Judge
content: Justice Shekhar Yadav of the Allahabad High Court said that due to the advent of mobile phones, communication between family members has come to an end, leading to loneliness and forcing people to commit suicide.

title: Huge Drug Money Racket In Telangana Busted, $30 Million In Cash Seized
content: The Telangana Eagle Force has dismantled a major hawala network responsible for laundering drug money, seizing over $30 million (Rs 264 crore) and catching 20 people across five states.

title: Condemn Violation Of Sovereignty: PM Speaks To Qatar Emir After Israel Strikes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi held a telephone conversation with Emir of the State of Qatar, Sheikh Tamim Bin Hamad Al-Thani, expressing his deep concern over the recent attacks in Doha.

title: Delhi's Mental Health Institute Has No MRI, CT Machines, Spot Check Reveals
content: A surprise inspection by Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta on Wednesday exposed gaps at the Institute of Human Behaviour and Allied Sciences (IHBAS)

title: NASA Mars Rover Finds Strongest Hints Yet Of Potential Signs Of Ancient Life
content: NASA's Mars rover Perseverance has uncovered rocks in a dry river channel that may hold potential signs of ancient microscopic life, scientists reported Wednesday.

title: Zelensky Floats Europe "Air Shield" Idea Day After Russia's Polish Incursion
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Wednesday that an incursion into Poland by Russian drones meant Europe had to work on creating a joint air defence and an "effective air shield."

title: Explained: What Are Gerbara Drones Used By Russia In Polish Incursion
content: A suspected Russian drone incursion in Poland on Wednesday, which provoked deep alarm as Moscow's war in Ukraine spilled onto the territory of a NATO member, was conducted at least in part with Gerbera drones, according to a Polish army official.

title: Ex Nepal PM's Wife Suffers Injuries As Home Set Ablaze, Recovering In Hospital
content: Rajyalaxmi Chitrakar, the wife of Nepal's ex-prime minister Jhalanath Khanal, suffered burn injuries on Tuesday after protesters set their house on fire.

title: How to win your league: Expert picks, backup plans and more
content: If you read only one fantasy hockey story, read this one: your guide to draft, play and win your league like an expert.

content: Make your fantasy hockey draft strategy easier with detailed defensemen tiers and a guide to the position.

title: Indian delegation visits Cambodia to bolster cashew trade and investment
content: The quality of Cambodian cashews, particularly premium varieties like M23, is highly sought after in the Indian market.

content: After The Hindu‚Äôs report on poor-quality premix khichdi and protein packets, WCD and ICDS officials meet union representatives, promising to escalate concerns to the Centre

title: Coastal campaign under way in Kozhikode against drug trafficking
content: The campaign is aimed at addressing substance addiction among fishers and allied workers, say officials

title: IIPD a model movement, says Adoor Gopalakrishnan
content: The International Institute for People with Disabilities is being developed as a world-class centre for the comprehensive development of differently abled people under the Thiruvananthapuram-based Different Art Centre

title: Leaders in Nepal, India call for engagement to prevent isolation of Nepal
content: ‚ÄúIndia, the U.S., and China should assure Nepal that the country will not face international isolation because of the current political situation,‚Äù says vice-president of Nepali Congress Bimalendra Nidhi

title: ECI targeted¬†Pawan Khera for posing questions: Congress
content: Party leader Singhvi points out how the EC resisted accepting Aadhaar as the proof of identity in the Special Intensive Revision exercise in Bihar despite the top court‚Äôs repeated suggestions

title: Airports may face fee cuts for poor passenger service
content: Regulatory body to appoint third party to monitor service delivery; airports that perform better will get a bonus

title: Evacuation plan ready to bring all Telugus stranded in Nepal back home, says Lokesh
content: 217 people from A.P. are in Nepal, says the RTGS Minister, adding that a flight will evacuate the stranded on Thursday

title: Meeting on September 16 to discuss ambiguities in new roster; DPAR asked to review
content: Officials of the DPAR, Social Welfare Department, State govt. representatives and members of the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes Employees Association to attend

title: For Hindu Bengalis, CAA is irrelevant: Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma says Hindu Bengalis have not used the Citizenship (Amendment) Act route, because they are certain of their identity as citizens

title: Cabinet approves doubling of Bhagalpur‚ÄìDumka‚ÄìRampurhat single railway line costing ‚Çπ3,169 Crore
content: The enhanced line capacity will improve mobility, providing enhanced efficiency and service reliability, an Indian Railways spokesperson said

title: ‚ÄòDuped by agent, 15 Indians pinned down in Ukraine-Russia war zone‚Äô
content: All of them went to Moscow on student or visitor visa in the past six months. They are now stuck in the Donetsk region, say two of the recruits

title: Widespread protests by opposition against new security law¬†enacted in Maharashtra
content: The Maha Vikas Aghadi staged state-wide protests citing concerns over potential misuse of the law to suppress dissent. MVA leaders also questioned the need for a new law

title: India to send special flights to Nepal
content: Kathmandu‚Äôs Tribhovan International Airport resumed flight operations and various airlines announced resumption of flight services from September 11, 2025

title: ‚ÄòAustralia against U.S. tariffs, but QUAD remains relevant‚Äô
content: Philip Green, Australia‚Äôs High Commissioner to India and Bhutan, who was in Bengaluru recently, speaks in an exclusive interview with The Hindu

content: The meeting with Commerce Secretary comes a day before EU negotiators sit down with the Indian government to discuss EU-India Free Trade Agreement

content: Court notes that only 27 of 170 witnesses had been examined in over 12 years, highlights the right to speedy trial as a fundamental right under Article 21

content: Sometimes those who investigate must also be investigated, says the court, directing that the probe be  headed by an officer not below the rank of an Assistant Commissioner of Police

content: The visit features professional interactions, including cross-training visits, joint diving exercises, yoga sessions, and sports fixtures, furthering the India-France naval partnership

content: ‚ÄòCeiling of ‚Çπ10,000 per month fixed 18 years ago under Maintenance and Welfare of Parents and Senior Citizens Act is too meagre in present cost inflation index‚Äô

title: International conference on Indian manuscripts to begin on September 11
content: Over 1,100 scholars, experts, institutions, and cultural practitioners will take part in the three-day meet in Delhi

title: Supreme Court flags Governors sitting on Bills as Centre terms dispute a ‚Äòfalse alarm‚Äô
content: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta says a State and its Governor must act ‚Äúcollaboratively‚Äù to ensure smooth working of  Constitution

title: Women conservancy workers approach Madras High Court seeking SHRC inquiry into police excesses
content: Their case has been listed for hearing before Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan on Thursday

title: ‚ÄòPower of knowledge has been the driving force in efforts at improving people‚Äôs lives‚Äô
content: The Rural Development and Panchayat Raj Minister was speaking after inaugurating the renovated S.M. Pandit Rang Mandir auditorium

title: State Teachers‚Äô Award prize money will be hiked: Minister
content: Prize money for the Prof. Joseph Mundassery Memorial Literary Award will also be increased from ‚Çπ10,000 to ‚Çπ25,000

title: IIT Palakkad partners with Buimerc for social entrepreneurship
content: The initiative aims to foster social entrepreneurship in Kerala, with plans to expand its reach nationwide

title: Radiant Kochi
content: Over 25 years, The Hindu has captured Kochi in its myriad colours and flavours, chronicling the city‚Äôs vibrant spirit and untold stories

title: Special educators‚Äô appointment: Kerala govt. yet to take follow-up steps on SC order
content: The State has over 1.23 lakh differently abled students, with more than 2,700 special educators currently working under Samagra Shiksha Kerala on a contract basis, according to an affidavit filed in the apex court

title: Safeguarding federalism vital for nation‚Äôs unity: Chief Minister
content: At the CPI State meet in Alappuzha, he calls for a broad united front against the politics of the Sangh Parivar and the BJP

title: At least 10 undertrials fleeing Nepal jail detained in Bihar
content: India-Nepal bus service stopped; businesses in bordering areas hit; Sashastra Seema Bal on high alert on 729-km-long porous India-Nepal border in Bihar

title: A grandson‚Äôs book brings joy back to grandmother battling memory loss
content: Marykuttiyude Orma Pusthakam, by Class VI student John Justin, is his attempt to keep the bond with his grandmother alive through storytelling

title: Various organisations celebrate Basava Sanskruti Abhiyan in Bagalkot
content: Seers, leaders urge community members to record their religion as Lingayat during the State-wide census

title: Cardamom price shows positive trend in peak crop season
content: This year the market is showing an increasing trend in the main harvesting season, with farmers receiving around ‚Çπ2,500 to ‚Çπ2,600 per kg cardamom

title: Watch: O Panneerselvam open to rejoining AIADMK under conditions
content: Former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister O Panneerselvam has indicated he may rejoin the AIADMK if the party unites under Edappadi K Palaniswami‚Äôs leadership, though several issues must be discussed first.

title: Madras High Court dispenses with the appearance of Minister Duraimurugan, his wife before special court in Chennai
content: Justice N. Sathish Kumar passes the interim order after being informed of a non bailable arrest warrant issued against the Minister due to his nonappearance before the special court

title: YSRCP unlikely to attend Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly session beginning September 18
content: The ruling NDA government, besides being biased against the opposition party, is denying it the ‚Äúdemocratic space,‚Äù alleges Jagan Mohan Reddy

title: Vahana Mitra scheme will be launched on Dasara, says A.P. CM
content: Naidu accuses YSRCP president Jagan Mohan Reddy of resorting to malicious propaganda and dares him for a debate on the floors of the Assembly

title: The great patch-up: Trump tempers tariff tantrum, re-engages a willing PM Modi
content: After weeks of tension and tariff threats, the US and India are tentatively re-engaging in trade talks, spurred by concerns in Washington that a hardline approach is pushing New Delhi closer to Russia and China. Despite President Trump's outreach and PM Modi's positive response, significant disagreements remain, particularly regarding trade barriers and India's purchase of Russian oil.

title: Asia Cup: 'Hardik is my brother'; Shivam Dube shuts down critics on comparison
content: Shivam Dube dismissed comparisons with Hardik Pandya, emphasizing his respect and learning from the star all-rounder. In the Asia Cup opener, India chose Dube over Arshdeep Singh, a strategic move that bolstered the batting lineup.

title: World‚Äôs richest reshuffle: Ellison tops Musk; Oracle‚Äôs 41% rally drives $101bn gain
content: Larry Ellison, Oracle's co-founder, has surpassed Elon Musk to become the world's richest person in 2025. Oracle's stock soared after a record-breaking earnings report, increasing Ellison's net worth by $101 billion in a single day, reaching $393 billion. Tesla's declining share value contributed to Musk's drop to $385 billion, ending his reign at the top.

title: Who is Charlie Kirk? Trump ally shot during Utah campus event; Know all about him
content: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk was shot Wednesday at Utah Valley University during an event. Kirk, CEO of Turning Point USA, sustained a gunshot wound near his neck and is in critical condition. Authorities have a suspect in custody following the incident at the Sorensen Center courtyard. Trump urged prayers for Kirk.

title: The iPhone that Apple 'killed' after three years
content: Apple has discontinued the Plus-sized iPhone after a three-year run, replacing it with the new, slimmer, and lighter Air model priced at $999. The Plus, like the Mini before it, failed to attract enough buyers, as consumers preferred either the standard iPhone or the Pro models with enhanced features.

title: Trump wants EU to impose 100% tariffs on India, China - but it is unlikely to agree; here's why
content: The European Union is unlikely to impose hefty tariffs on India and China for purchasing Russian oil, despite suggestions from the US. The EU, while aligning Russia sanctions with the US, prefers targeted measures over broad tariffs.

title: Sri Lanka, B'desh and now Nepal: India's neighbourhood on edge - why it's a worry
content: South Asia is experiencing widespread political turmoil, with Nepal recently joining the list of nations facing abrupt regime changes due to public anger over corruption and social media bans. Similar events have unfolded in Bangladesh and Sri Lanka, driven by youth-led protests against inequality and economic mismanagement.

title: Laken Snelling case: Cheer video returns; charged in infant‚Äôs death
content: Laken Snelling, a former University of Kentucky cheerleader, was arrested after her newborn baby was found dead in her apartment closet. She faces charges including abuse of a corpse and tampering with evidence. The cause of death is undetermined, and Snelling is currently out on bond awaiting her next court hearing while the investigation continues.

title: Meet Tejasvi Manoj: Teen cybersecurity pioneer; recognised by TIME 2025
content: Inspired by her grandfather's near brush with an online scam, 16-year-old Tejasvi Manoj from Texas developed Shield Seniors. This platform educates and protects seniors from cybercrime, offering tools to identify scams and report fraud. Tejasvi, recognized as TIME's Kid of the Year 2025, aims to empower seniors to navigate the internet safely and confidently, reducing their vulnerability to financial exploitation.

title: Nepal Gen Z protest: Who is Sushila Karki? Frontrunner to lead interim govt
content: Nepal's Gen Z protest movement, fueled by anger over corruption and a social media ban, has selected former Chief Justice Sushila Karki as its interim leader. Karki's neutrality and respected civic standing made her the preferred choice to represent the protesters in upcoming negotiations amidst violent unrest and curfews in Kathmandu.

title: Trump tariff shock: Fitch warns US economy is slowing down
content: Fitch Ratings reports a US economic slowdown, projecting a deceleration from 2.8% in 2024 to 1.6% in 2025 and 2026. Consumer spending and government expenditure are weakening, while the labor market shows signs of softening with reduced job creation. Despite tariff impacts on inflation, the Fed is expected to ease policy with rate cuts.

title: Asia Cup: Ruthless India crush UAE by nine wickets ‚Äì Key talking points
content: India commenced their Asia Cup 2025 campaign with a dominant nine-wicket victory over the UAE. Kuldeep Yadav's mesmerizing spell of 4/7 and Shivam Dube's 3/4 dismantled UAE for a paltry 57. Abhishek Sharma's quickfire 30 and Shubman Gill's unbeaten 20 ensured a swift chase, reaching the target in just 4.3 overs.

title: Taylor Swift walks hand in hand with Travis Kelce at 1587 Prime soft launch
content: Taylor Swift supported Travis Kelce at the soft launch of his Kansas City steakhouse, 1587 Prime, co-owned with Patrick Mahomes. The couple arrived hand-in-hand, enjoying an intimate evening with friends and family, including Chiefs teammates. Swift's presence highlighted both Kelce's business venture and their strong relationship as they celebrated the restaurant's opening.

title: Al Nassr‚Äôs billion-dollar business: Who‚Äôs the highest-paid star?
content: Al Nassr has emerged as a football powerhouse, fueled by massive investments and the acquisition of global talents like Cristiano Ronaldo, Sadio Mane and Mohamed Simakan. Ronaldo's arrival significantly boosted revenue and attracted other stars with lucrative contracts. The club's high salary structure, exemplified by Ronaldo's $275 million annual earnings, reshapes football's financial landscape.

title: 'Phillies Karen' identified & fired after taking Harrison Bader home run ball from young fan
content: During a Phillies vs. Marlins game, Harrison Bader's home run ball was caught by Drew Feltwell, who gifted it to his son Lincoln. A woman demanded the ball, sparking outrage online and earning her the moniker "Phillies Karen." Despite mistaken identity claims involving Leslie-Ann Kravitz and Cheryl Richardson-Wagner, the woman's true identity remains unconfirmed.

title: Asia Cup: PIL in Supreme Court against India vs Pakistan clash; seeks cancellation
content: A PIL has been filed in the Supreme Court of India seeking cancellation of the India-Pakistan Asia Cup match scheduled for September 14 in Dubai, citing national security concerns following the Pahalgam terror attack. The petitioners argue that the match undermines national dignity and disregards the sacrifices of Indian soldiers.

title: Shaquille O‚ÄôNeal on Swift-Kelce: Wedding buzz grows; ‚ÄòMay they last forever‚Äô
content: Shaquille O‚ÄôNeal learned about Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift's engagement through social media, expressing his happiness and wishing them well. O'Neal is also preparing for his move to ESPN and launching Shaq‚ÄëA‚ÄëLicious Gummies, sneaker-shaped candies. He humorously reflected on pre-fame struggles related to his size, contrasting it with his current success.

title: Asia Cup: India humiliate hosts UAE; create T20I milestone in Dubai
content: India began their Asia Cup 2025 campaign in Dubai. They achieved the fastest-ever chase in men‚Äôs T20I history. India chased down UAE's 58-run target in just 4.3 overs, winning by nine wickets. Kuldeep Yadav took 4 wickets for 7 runs. Abhishek Sharma scored 30 off 13 balls. Shubman Gill remained unbeaten on 20.

title: 'Closest to war since WW2': Russian drones over Poland push Europe to brink
content: Tensions surged as Russian drones breached Polish airspace, prompting Warsaw to invoke NATO's Article 4 and scramble allied forces. Several drones were shot down, marking a significant escalation as it's the first time a NATO member engaged Russian objects within its territory.

title: Asia Cup: Why Suryakumar Yadav withdrew appeal, denying Sanju Samson‚Äôs quick thinking
content: Ending a 16-match toss drought, India chose to field and decimated UAE for 57 runs, with Kuldeep Yadav claiming four wickets. A bizarre incident involving Junaid Siddique led to Suryakumar Yadav withdrawing an appeal in a sporting gesture. Despite the reprieve, Siddique was soon dismissed, and India's dominant bowling display secured a comprehensive victory.

title: 'Real fight is between Karisma Kapoor and Priya Sachdev': Sunjay Kapur mother's lawyer
content: Following Sunjay Kapoor's death, a family dispute has emerged, with Karisma Kapoor's children, Samaira and Kiaan, contesting his will in the Delhi High Court, alleging forgery by his widow, Priya Sachdev. The legal battle involves claims to Sunjay's estate, with his mother, Rani Kapur, also a party to the case. Priya's advocate asserts the plaintiffs are already trust beneficiaries.

title: Asia Cup: Not quite Jonny Bairstow! How Samson was denied chance to recreate Ashes drama
content: During India's Asia Cup 2025 match against UAE, a towel falling from Shivam Dube's waist distracted batter Junaid Siddique. Sanju Samson's quick thinking led to a potential run-out, reminiscent of the Bairstow incident. However, India withdrew the appeal in a sporting gesture. Kuldeep Yadav's exceptional bowling and Dube's all-round performance highlighted India's dominant victory.

title: Berlin replaces Boston: Germany emerges top choice for Indian students; Canada slips
content: Indian students‚Äô study-abroad dreams are being redefined as traditional hubs like the US, UK, and Canada falter under visa curbs and rising costs. With Canada rejecting nearly 80% of applications and UK work visas plunging by half, Germany has emerged as the new epicenter. Affordable education, strong job pathways, and pragmatic value now outweigh colonial prestige.

title: 'Felt like garbage': Travis Kelce takes full responsibility for injury to opponent
content: In the Kansas City Chiefs' season opener, Travis Kelce collided with rookie Xavier Worthy, causing a shoulder injury that sidelined Worthy. Kelce took responsibility, expressing frustration and acknowledging Worthy's importance to the team's offense. Despite the setback, Kelce aimed to rally the team, highlighting the need for improved performance and a stronger start.

title: 'You don't arrest Voltaire': Decoding France's history of protests
content: ‚Äã‚ÄãThis September, Paris burned, Rennes saw a bus ablaze, trains were halted in the southwest, and riot police clashed with demonstrators under the banner of ‚ÄúBloquons Tout‚Äù‚Äîthe ‚ÄúBlock Everything‚Äù movement. Over 200 arrests on the first day, despite Macron deploying an astonishing 80,000 police nationwide. Interior Minister Bruno Retailleau accused the protestors of trying to create ‚Äúa climate of insurrection.‚Äù To which the French reply: Mais bien s√ªr.

title: Asia Cup: Confusion at toss! SKY mishap takes centre stage - What happened?
content: The Asia Cup 2025 began with a funny incident in Dubai as Suryakumar Yadav's toss confusion briefly overshadowed the start. After winning the toss, Suryakumar's delay in communicating the decision to UAE's captain led to a lighthearted moment. India chose to bowl first on a fresh pitch, while both teams revealed their playing XIs, ready to compete.

title: Asia Cup 2025: Sanju Samson in? Massive surprise for UAE game
content: Sanju Samson has secured his place in India's playing XI for their Asia Cup clash in Dubai, despite speculation surrounding Shubman Gill's return and Tilak Varma's presence. India has strategically bolstered their batting lineup by including Shivam Dube and surprisingly excluding Arshdeep Singh. India won the toss and chose to bowl first.

title: France unrest: Nearly 300 held; what triggered 'block everything' protests?
content: France is currently experiencing widespread protests fueled by public anger towards President Macron's government. Demonstrators clashed with police, blocked roads, and set fires in major cities, leading to over 200 arrests. The unrest stems from austerity measures and political instability, with unions and activists demanding change and further action is expected, raising concerns about continued disruption.

title: Drinking green tea may help combat Alzheimer‚Äôs ‚Äì but with an added ingredient
content: Research indicates that combining green tea's antioxidant, EGCG, with nicotinamide (vitamin B3) may rejuvenate aging brain cells and help clear harmful protein buildup linked to Alzheimer's. Lab studies reveal this pairing restores energy in neurons, boosting their ability to clear amyloid-beta plaques. Regular green tea consumption is associated with sharper memory and lower dementia risk.

title: Rohit Sharma practising for Australia tour? Truth behind viral video
content: A resurfaced video of Rohit Sharma practicing sparked speculation about his return, but it was confirmed as old footage from the 2025 IPL season. Despite concerns raised by a recent hospital visit, Sharma has cleared a fitness test and is set to join Virat Kohli in the ODI series against Australia, marking their return to international cricket after a break.

title: Phillies Karen story explained: What controversy reveals about the US mindset
content: In Miami, a Phillies-Marlins game took a turn when a fan, Drew Feltwell, caught a home run ball and gifted it to his son. A woman aggressively demanded the ball, leading Feltwell to surrender it to protect his child. The incident went viral, branding the woman as the ‚ÄúPhillies Karen.‚Äù Despite the backlash against her, Feltwell urged for kindness.

title: 'Pakistan captain can win smaller event like Asia Cup': Suryakumar warned of 'banana peel'
content: Astrologer Greenstone Lobo suggests predicting winners in smaller tournaments like the Asia Cup is more complex than forecasting World Cups due to the influence of captains' horoscopes. While India, led by Suryakumar Yadav, are favorites, Lobo highlights Pakistan's Salman Ali Agha as a strong contender, potentially making the Asia Cup a challenge for India.

title: PM Modi speaks to Meloni: Trade deal in focus; Ukraine conflict discussed
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni engaged in a phone conversation, reinforcing their dedication to strengthening the India-Italy Strategic Partnership. Discussions encompassed bilateral relations, trade collaborations, and pressing global matters, notably the conflict in Ukraine. Modi expressed gratitude for Italy's support in finalizing a mutually advantageous India-EU trade agreement and advancing connectivity through the IMEEC initiative.

title: Suhas Subramanyam: Indian-origin Congressman raises voice on hate crimes against Hindus S
content: Congressman Suhas Subramanyam has strongly condemned the recent hate crimes targeting Hindu temples in the US, citing incidents in Indiana and Utah as part of a disturbing trend. Speaking at Capitol Hill, the first Indian-American from Virginia called for a comprehensive response, including increased funding to protect religious institutions.

title: MLB: Detroit Tigers executives hit with disturbing misconduct allegations
content: Since 2023, the Detroit Tigers organization faces scrutiny following misconduct allegations against at least eight men, including executives and broadcast partners. These allegations, reported by The Athletic, encompass offensive comments and physical confrontations within the workplace. The organization has yet to publicly address the situation, raising concerns about workplace culture and accountability.

title: MMA divisional rankings: How much did Nassourdine Imavov rise at middleweight?
content: Nassourdine Imavov beats caio Borralho in the uFC Fight Night main event . he moves up to no. 3 in the latest ESPN middleweight rankings . the other weight class in which rankings change is heavyweight, where Marcin Tybura drops out of the top 10 .

title: WBC reveals championship ring for Canelo vs. Crawford fight
content: the undisputed super middleweight title fight between canelo alvarez and challenger Terence Crawford has a key piece of jewelry at stake . the ring, designed by WBC strategic partner Rasheen Farlow, is valued at over $100,000 . a collection of green stones makes up the trademark green belt in the center .

title: World Cup onside/offside: Good win for USMNT, last dance for Lionel Messi?
content: Mauricio Pochettino tinkered both in strategy and lineup to improve the agile, high-possession mentality of hajime Moriyasu's Japan . he went back to the playbook from his Southampton and Tottt . this week's world cup qualifiers took center stage .

title: Survivor pool strategy: The top teams to take in Week 2
content: ESPN Eliminator Challenge is one of the most fun and simple games to play this season . the rules are simple: pick one team, and as long as they win (or tie), you advance to the next round . if they lose, you are out .

title: What makes a baseball player exciting? We asked two rising MLB stars
content: a baseball player bracket skews young, with the average age (26.4) more than two years younger than the MLB average (28.6) . the bracket embodies several common qualities among our 32 entrants . "i just like seeing guys who can do a lot of different things on the field," says a representative .

title: Matchup rankings: Drake Maye, Ricky Pearsall stand out in Week 2
content: the matchup rankings provide a schedule-independent method to evaluate positional matchups each week . each defense ranked in order of most to least favorable for opposing players at all four skill positions . this provides a fairer approach to judging the quality of individual matches . if you're torn between two similar players, start the player with the superior matchup .

title: Fantasy reaction: Bigsby trade a boon to Etienne's fantasy value
content: the fantasy football buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the NFL . a big spike in Jacory Croskey-Merritt's start rate after his nice performance in Week 1 . Travis Etienne Jr. is the biggest winner here after leading the team .

title: Pulisic rates 9/10 as win vs. Japan gets USMNT back on track
content: alejandro Zendejas and Folarin Balogun both score as the united states defeats Japan 2-0 . the men's national team quickly bounced back with a more proactive attack through an experimental 3-4-3 formation . in a first half, the home side created danger through high-pressing fullbacks Max Arfsten and Alex Freeman .

title: Bottom 10: The spitting distance between Florida and Arizona State
content: "Wounded arms must carry the load" is spitting off the edge of the world, out in the night . "spitting off the Edge of the World" is here at Bottom 10 Headquarters . Pat McAfee donates all the sleeves that he cuts off his shishi .

title: Potential managerial and front office changes on the horizon

title: NFL execs predict the biggest award winners: Picks for MVP, best rookies, more

title: 'Nacua must mix his oatmeal with cement': Rams can't overstate WR's importance
